001package io.github.ai4ci.abm;
002
003import static io.github.ai4ci.flow.mechanics.ModelOperation.updateOutbreakState;
004import static io.github.ai4ci.flow.mechanics.ModelOperation.updatePersonState;
005
006import io.github.ai4ci.flow.mechanics.ModelOperation;
007import io.github.ai4ci.flow.mechanics.ModelOperation.OutbreakStateUpdater;
008import io.github.ai4ci.flow.mechanics.ModelOperation.PersonStateUpdater;
009
010/**
011 * Collection of pre-packaged model update functions (hooks) that are applied
012 * during the simulation update cycle. These are intended to be small, reusable
013 * processing units that can be combined by the
014 * {@link io.github.ai4ci.flow.mechanics.Updater Updater} to produce the final
015 * per-day changes to both {@link OutbreakState} and {@link PersonState}.
016 *
017 * <p>
018 * Where these are used in the update cycle:
019 * <ul>
020 * <li>The {@link io.github.ai4ci.flow.mechanics.Updater Updater} builds a list
021 * of outbreak and person processors from the values declared in the enums
022 * below. Those processors are applied in the {@code updateState} phase of the
023 * update cycle (see
024 * {@link io.github.ai4ci.flow.mechanics.Updater#updateState(Outbreak)}).</li>
025 * <li>Order and timing: outbreak processors are applied as pre- and
026 * post-processors around the per-agent updates (see
027 * {@link io.github.ai4ci.flow.mechanics.Updater#updateState(Outbreak)}), while
028 * person processors run for each agent during the agent-level
029 * {@code updateState} (see
030 * {@link io.github.ai4ci.flow.mechanics.Updater#updateState(Person)}). The
031 * {@link io.github.ai4ci.flow.mechanics.Updater} constructor collects the enum
032 * values into the processor lists so adding a new enum value automatically
033 * exposes it to the update loop.</li>
034 * <li>These functions execute after behaviour and policy state transitions have
035 * been determined for the upcoming day. That means they can see the new
036 * behaviour/policy choices (the state machine will already have computed the
037 * next behaviour/policy), but they execute while the rest of the model
038 * (states/histories) is still in the transitional phase described in
039 * {@link io.github.ai4ci.flow.mechanics.Updater Updater}'s class-level
040 * documentation.</li>
041 * </ul>
042 *
043 * <p>
044 * Design notes and extension points:
045 * <ul>
046 * <li>Each enum value below wraps a {@link ModelOperation.OutbreakStateUpdater}
047 * or {@link ModelOperation.PersonStateUpdater} â€” small lambdas that accept a
048 * selector and a mutator/consumer. Use
049 * {@link io.github.ai4ci.flow.mechanics.ModelOperation#updatePersonState(java.util.function.Predicate, ModelOperation.TriConsumer)}
050 * and
051 * {@link io.github.ai4ci.flow.mechanics.ModelOperation#updateOutbreakState(java.util.function.Predicate, ModelOperation.TriConsumer)}
052 * to create new updaters in the same style.</li>
053 * <li>Person processors run after in-host and risk models have been advanced to
054 * (t+1) but before the newly built state is committed to the agent. This allows
055 * processors to observe computed infection/risk signals and modify the next
056 * state builder accordingly (e.g., set immunisation dose, schedule importation
057 * exposures, or set other next-day modifiers).</li>
058 * <li>Because these updaters are invoked late in the state construction phase,
059 * they should avoid mutating long-lived shared structures; prefer modifying the
060 * provided builders.</li>
061 * </ul>
062 *
063 * <p>
064 * Work-in-progress / Vaccination note:
065 * <ul>
066 * <li>The {@link PersonUpdaterFn#IMMUNISATION_PROTOCOL} is provided as a
067 * placeholder to show where vaccination/immunisation logic can be implemented.
068 * The current implementation merely sets {@code immunisationDose} to 0 on the
069 * next builder and should be considered incomplete. Full vaccination routines
070 * (eligibility, prioritisation, multi-dose scheduling, waning immunity, and
071 * interaction with the in-host model) are not yet implemented in this helper
072 * and should be authored either as a new person processor (via
073 * {@link io.github.ai4ci.flow.mechanics.Updater#withPersonProcessor}) or by
074 * extending this enum with a complete implementation that consults the
075 * outbreak's {@link io.github.ai4ci.config.execution.ExecutionConfiguration
076 * ExecutionConfiguration} and the agent's demographic/state.</li>
077 * </ul>
078 */
079public class ModelUpdate {
080
081        /**
082         * Outbreak-level updaters: run once per day during the {@code updateState}
083         * phase (see
084         * {@link io.github.ai4ci.flow.mechanics.Updater#updateState(Outbreak)}).
085         * These get access to the outbreak's next-state builder and the current
086         * outbreak object so they can make deterministic or probabilistic
087         * modifications to the next state before it is finalised. This is intended
088         * for global updates that affect the outbreak as a whole (e.g., available
089         * tests, contact detection probability) rather than person-level updates.
090         */
091        public static enum OutbreakUpdaterFn {
092                /**
093                 * Default no-op outbreak updater. Kept so the Updater has at least one
094                 * outbreak processor by default. Outbreak-level processors are run once
095                 * per day during {@code updateState} on the outbreak builder and can
096                 * modify global parameters (e.g. available tests, contact detection
097                 * probability).
098                 */
099                DEFAULT(
100                                updateOutbreakState(
101                                                (outbreak) -> true, (builder, outbreak, rng) -> {
102                                                        // OutbreakBaseline baseline = outbreak.getBaseline();
103                                                        // OutbreakState current = outbreak.getCurrentState();
104                                                }
105                                )
106                ),;
107
108                private OutbreakStateUpdater fn;
109
110                private OutbreakUpdaterFn(ModelOperation.OutbreakStateUpdater fn) {
111                        this.fn = fn;
112                }
113
114                /**
115                 * The function that performs the outbreak-level update. This is a lambda
116                 * that accepts a selector (predicate) and a mutator (tri-consumer) and
117                 * returns an
118                 *
119                 * @return a {@link OutbreakStateUpdater} that can be applied to the
120                 *         outbreak's next state builder during the update cycle.
121                 */
122                public OutbreakStateUpdater fn() {
123                        return this.fn;
124                }
125        }
126
127        /**
128         * Person-level updaters: run for every person during the {@code updateState}
129         * phase (see
130         * {@link io.github.ai4ci.flow.mechanics.Updater#updateState(Person)}). These
131         * get access to the person's next-state builder and the current person
132         * object so they can make deterministic or probabilistic modifications to
133         * the next state before it is finalised.
134         */
135        public static enum PersonUpdaterFn {
136                /**
137                 * Default no-op person updater. This exists so the Updater has at least
138                 * one person processor by default and demonstrates the expected lambda
139                 * shape.
140                 */
141                DEFAULT(
142                                updatePersonState((person) -> true, (builder, person, rng) -> {
143                                        // PersonBaseline baseline = person.getBaseline();
144                                        // PersonState current = person.getCurrentState();
145
146                                })
147                ),
148
149                /**
150                 * Immunisation (vaccination) protocol placeholder.
151                 *
152                 * <p>
153                 * Current behaviour: sets the next state's immunisation dose to 0.0 as a
154                 * placeholder. Intended use:
155                 * <ol>
156                 * <li>Be extended to consult outbreak-level vaccine supply and
157                 * prioritisation.</li>
158                 * <li>Apply doses to eligible individuals by mutating the next-state
159                 * builder (e.g. {@code builder.setImmunisationDose(...)}) and schedule
160                 * follow-up doses.</li>
161                 * <li>Interact with the in-host model and risk model so that vaccination
162                 * affects susceptibility, severity and waning parameters.</li>
163                 * </ol>
164                 *
165                 * Important: the full vaccination workflow (eligibility, queueing,
166                 * multi-dose schedules and waning immunity) is not implemented here.
167                 * Treat this enum value as a scaffolding point for productionising
168                 * vaccine logic; prefer implementing a dedicated person processor or
169                 * service that can be added via
170                 * {@link io.github.ai4ci.flow.mechanics.Updater#withPersonProcessor(java.util.function.Predicate, io.github.ai4ci.flow.mechanics.ModelOperation.TriConsumer)}
171                 * when building an experiment.
172                 */
173                IMMUNISATION_PROTOCOL(
174                                updatePersonState((person) -> true, (builder, person, rng) -> {
175                                        // PersonBaseline baseline = person.getBaseline();
176                                        // PersonState current = person.getCurrentState();
177                                        builder.setImmunisationDose(0D);
178                                })
179                ),
180
181                /**
182                 * Importation protocol: demonstrates how one might seed exposure on the
183                 * next day using a per-person probability scaled by model parameters and
184                 * the agent's mobility. This adds an importation exposure to the next
185                 * state builder if the random draw succeeds; otherwise it leaves the
186                 * importation exposure as zero.
187                 */
188                IMPORTATION_PROTOCOL(
189                                updatePersonState((person) -> true, (builder, person, rng) -> {
190                                        // PersonBaseline baseline = person.getBaseline();
191                                        // PersonState current = person.getCurrentState();
192                                        if (rng.uniform() < ModelNav.modelParam(person)
193                                                        .getImportationProbability()
194                                                        * person.getCurrentState().getAdjustedMobility()) {
195                                                builder.setImportationExposure(2D);
196                                        } else {
197                                                builder.setImportationExposure(0D);
198                                        }
199                                })
200                )
201
202                ;
203
204                private PersonStateUpdater fn;
205
206                private PersonUpdaterFn(ModelOperation.PersonStateUpdater fn) {
207                        this.fn = fn;
208                }
209
210                /**
211                 * The function that performs the person-level update. This is a lambda
212                 * that accepts a selector (predicate) and a mutator (tri-consumer) and
213                 * returns a
214                 *
215                 * @return a {@link PersonStateUpdater} that can be applied to a person's
216                 *         next state builder during the update cycle.
217                 */
218                public PersonStateUpdater fn() {
219                        return this.fn;
220                }
221        }
222
223        // static Logger log = LoggerFactory.getLogger(ModelUpdate.class);
224
225}
